subject: RE: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... Sure, but what if this set up should only be run once for the entire class? (which was Allen s original question if I m not mistaken) For example, imagine
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On

> If all your testMethods() use the same environment (the same
> setup), you can remove duplication by moving the common set
> up code into setUp().

Sure, but what if this set up should only be run once for the entire class?
(which was Allen's original question if I'm not mistaken)

For example, imagine that the class to test does some verification on an XML
file. In this case, the one-time set up should simply parse the XML file,
create the DOM tree and then use the class to perform various verifications
on this tree. And of course, we don't want to re-parse it every time.

> > yet I'm finding tons of places
> > where I need a one time setup and teardown for the whole TestCase.
>
> Are your tests really independent from each other?

I can come up with a lot of examples where such a fine grained (or coarse
grained, in this case) setUp/tearDown life cycle is necessary without the
tests being dependent on each other.
